name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's definition of law and order, argue @benjaminwittes and @qjurecic, is that "those who oppose him should be punished and those who support him—or simply those for whom he has solicitude—should be free to do as they please." https://t.co/JeJ4VSwyDN

name: TheAtlantic
text: What would it take for Republican leaders to admit to themselves that Trump’s loyalty cult is destroying the country its members claim to love? @anneapplebaum asks in our July/August cover story, up now. https://t.co/WDr8Rd1Nmh https://t.co/ELA55aQaEx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earlier this year, @jpinsk was asked to give a commencement speech, but once the pandemic hit, he didn’t know what to say. So he asked a novelist, a therapist, a Buddhist teacher, and 16 other experts for their advice: https://t.co/Bw5j8mZosy

name: TheAtlantic
text: The HBO Max documentary “On the Record” is about a broken system and an alleged abuser. But it is more profoundly about the women whose careers were ended by pervasive sexism in the music industry, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/GPVsJ31cZ0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Antifa traces its roots to Europe in the 1920s and ’30s, but for a long time the movement didn’t occupy the American spotlight. Trump changed that, @PeterBeinart wrote in 2017. The result has been explosive growth. https://t.co/aiEAQRK383

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lady Gaga's "Chromatica" tries to access the joy of pop as a sensory experience. But the context of 2020 turmoil makes it land strangely. @skornhaber reviews the singer's return to the dance floor: https://t.co/jl7A7hWJkf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: The Works of Christo via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/PBGPifJ6Al

name: TheAtlantic
text: Amid protests around the country, Trump wanted to be seen as strong. And he was willing to deploy the federal government’s firepower to make it happen, writes @PeterAtlantic: https://t.co/upBzMqGIXb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The First Amendment is no good if it is used to protect one side of the political spectrum but disregarded for the other," @AttorneyNora writes: https://t.co/G7KrMg1yoF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: Trump Is not the Richard Nixon of 1968. He’s the Mayor Daley and George Wallace of 1968. Latest in ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩  https://t.co/3WawFQaIIm
